questions.text: Leader of the ___
questions.hint: A popular political party of the time that the Nazis hated

questions.text: What was his prior occupation?
questions.hint: Someone who loads cargo onto ships from the dock

questions.text: What kind of image did he try to cultivate for himself?
questions.hint: Starts with 't'

questions.text: What was his biggest asset during elections?
questions.hint: Passionate speeches

questions.text: His election platform was not based on an ___
questions.hint: A system of ideas and ideals

questions.text: When making an appearance, he would always remove his ___ to emphasize that he was a member of the working class
questions.hint: A piece of fabric worn around the neck

questions.text: He became a member of the Reichstag in ___ and chairman of the KPD in ___
He split the ___ vote and ensured that Hindenburg won
questions.hint: left of centre

questions.text: The KPD's slogan was 'A vote for Hindenburg is a vote for ___; a vote for ___ is a vote for ___'
questions.hint: Voting for Hindenburg was voting for the leader of the Nazi party, and voting for the leader of the Nazi party was a vote for large-scale armed conflict

questions.text: He proposed that the SPD and KPD organize a ___ to topple Hitler, but this was not achieved
questions.hint: An period during which workers refuse to work

questions.text: He called for a ___ of Hitler's government
questions.hint: An overthrow of the government using violence

questions.text: He was arrested by the Gestapo in ___ and held in solitary confinement for ___ years
questions.hint: The year the Nazis were elected; 11 years

questions.text: He was ___ in the Buchenwald concentration camp on the orders of ___ in ___
questions.hint: Shot; The leader of the Nazi party; The year before the end of the war

questions.text: When he died, his body was immediately ___
questions.hint: The burning of a body

questions.text: The Nazis said he died in an ____
questions.hint: When Allies attacked Germany by dropping bombs

questions.text: This election was basically between ___, ___, and ___
questions.answer: adolph hitler, ernst thalmann, paul von hindenburg
questions.hint: The leader of the Nazi party, the leader of the KPD, and the president of Germany at the time

questions.text: Hindenburg's main election platform was that he was the only man able to stop ___
questions.hint: The leader of the Nazi party

questions.text: Hitler's main election platform was that he was the ___ of the German people
questions.hint: Saviour

questions.text: Hitler was allowed to run in the presidential election because he gained citizenship in ___
questions.hint: The year before the Nazis were elected

questions.text: Who was the winner of the 1932 presidential elections?
questions.hint: The man who was already president at the time

questions.text: Who did the winner elect as the chancellor?
questions.hint: ___ von papen

questions.text: True or false? Germany continued to have presidential elections after the Nazis took power, but they were only symbolic as Hitler always won 100% of the votes
True or false? Hindenburg did not like political office, and was only convinced to run so that he could stop Hitler from gaining power
In the first round of the election, the nominee had to win ___ percent of the vote. In the second round, the had to win the ___ percent of the vote
questions.hint: In the first round, the nominee needed a majority. In the second round, they needed a plurality

questions.text: True or false? The election always had to go through both rounds before a president was chosen
The Nazis conceived as Volksgemeinschaft as a ___ where a person's ___ determines their place in society
questions.hint: The Nazis were heavily focused on this aspect of humans during their rule

questions.text: What does 'Volksgemeinschaft' mean?
questions.hint: A community that belongs to the people

questions.text: True or false: the Nazis perverted the term 'Volksgemeinschaft' from its original meaning
The Nazi party saw history as an ongoing ___ between different 'races' for power
questions.hint: Another word for conflict

questions.text: The end goal of the Nazis was to promote 'racial hygiene' through the use of ___
questions.hint: The science of improving a human population by controlled breeding to increase the occurrence of desirable traits

questions.text: The Nazi party passed strict laws against ___
questions.hint: Two people of different races getting married

questions.text: Volksgemeinschaft laws passed by the Nazis created societal ___ and ___
questions.hint: Those on the inside of society and those on the outside of society

questionSets.focus: Youth and Children in the Volksgemeinschaft

questions.text: To help the Nazi party appeal to youth, the Nazis established ___
questions.hint: Groups for children that extolled Nazi values

questions.text: A Nazi group established for boys was the ___
questions.hint: A youth group for boys that taught its members complete devotion to Adolph Hitler

questions.text: A Nazi group established for girls was the ___
questions.hint: A youth group for girls that taught its members complete devotion to Adolph Hitler

questions.text: These Nazi groups emphasized the ___ over ___
questions.hint: The community over the person

questions.text: True or false? The boys in these groups, among other things, underwent military training
True or false? Members of these groups were required to swear allegiance to Hitler
True or false? Schools during Nazi rule had their curriculi heavily modified so as to be more 'Nazified'
The Nazis wanted schools to educate the children in 'The Spirit of ___'
questions.hint: The Nazis' form of government

questions.text: Teachers were forced to join the ___ or they would be fired
questions.hint: A national league for socialist teachers

questions.text: True or false? All children complied and joined a youth group
True or false? Children who were in 'resistance' groups would beat up Hitler Youth and steal their camping supplies
True or false? Children who were in 'resistance' groups saw the Hitler Youth as stuffy and conformist
Hans and Sophie Scholl formed the ___ resistance group that wrote anti-Nazi pamphlets
True or false? Hans and Sophie Scholl were never caught, but Nazi investigation forced them to stop publishing
One of the Nazis' goals was to restore 'proper' ___
questions.hint: The roles of men and women in society

questions.text: It was strongly encouraged that women be ___ and ___
questions.hint: A person who bears children; A person who is married

questions.text: The Nazis were very opposed to ___
questions.hint: An ideology that promotes equality between men and women

questions.text: The Nazis promoted the '3 Ks' among women: ___, ___, and ___
questions.hint: What Christians attend on Sunday; Young people; Preparing food

questions.text: Women in a ___ setting were strongly discouraged
questions.hint: The setting in a work environment which consists of highly skilled people

questions.text: Hitler said that ___ were the most important citizens
questions.hint: A woman who has children

questions.text: Nazis replaced women's groups with the ___
questions.hint: A league for german women

questions.text: Nazis wanted to raise the ___ of Aryan people
questions.hint: The rate at which children are born

questions.text: The Nazis were strongly against ___ and ___
questions.hint: Methods of controlling whether a child is conceived or not; The destruction of a fetus after impregnation

questions.text: If they had a certain number of children, women received ___
questions.hint: A physical reward for accomplishing something, usually worn around the neck

questions.text: The Nazis gave out a ___ for ___ marks when a couple got married
questions.hint: A loan given to a couple that gets married

questions.text: For each child a couple had, the Nazis forgave ___ marks from the marriage loan
___ was seen as the ideal mother. She became the 'first lady' of Nazism
questions.hint: Joseph Goebbels' wife

questions.text: Joseph Goebbels' wife had ___ children
T-4 was postware designation for a Nazi program of ___
questions.hint: The medical term for killing someone, done against their will

questions.text: Physicians were told to judge their patients as ___
questions.hint: A state of sickness in which the patient cannot be cured

questions.text: True or false? During the war, the parents of a severely deformed child wrote Hitler asking for permission to kill him
Hitler formed a committee called 'The Reich Committee for the Scientific ___ of Serious ___ and ___ illnesses'
questions.hint: To make a record of someone in a registry; Passed down via genetics; Present from birth

questions.text: True or false? After this, the Nazis used the precedent set to establish a euthanasia program for children with severe disabilities
The ___ began requiring doctors and midwives to report cases of newborns with disabilities
questions.hint: ministry of the interior

questions.text: Hitler signed a 'euthanasia decree' in ___
questions.hint: The year of the outbreak of World War 2

questions.text: ___ Brandt and Philipp ___ developed plans to extend the euthanasia program to adults
True or false? The adult euthanasia program targeted ONLY those deemed by the nazis as criminal, degenerate, dissident, feeble-minded, homosexual, idle, insane, or weak.
Over ___ people were forcibly sterilized as a part of T-4
___ people were euthanized as a part of T-4
___ laws were introduced at the annual Nuremberg Rally of the Nazi party
questions.hint: Laws that specifically oppress Jews

questions.text: People with ___ German grandparents were considered 'German or kindred blood'
People with ___ or ___ Jewish grandparents were considered Jewish
People with ___ or ___ Jewish grandparents were considered 'mischling' (crossbreed, of mixed-blood)
People with German blood were classified as 'racially ___'
questions.hint: Another word for normal, permitted

questions.text: True or false? Jews lost their citizenship and German-Jewish marriages were prohibited
In ___, these laws were extended to ___, ___, and their 'bastard offpsring'
questions.hint: 4 years before the war; A nomadic people who are discriminated against in Europe; People originally from Africa with dark skin

questions.text: The Law for the Protection of German Blood and German Honour prohibited German women under 45 years of age from ___
questions.hint: Being employed by a Jewish family to do housework

questions.text: The same law also prohibited ___ between Jews and Germans
questions.hint: Sex between a Jew and a German outside of marriage

questions.text: Interbreeding between the 'undesirable' races and Aryans was referred to as 'Rassenschande' or 'racial ___'
questions.hint: Harmful substances released into the environment

questions.text: The Reich Citizenship law declared people with German blood to be '___ of the Reich' while non-Aryans were 'state ___'
questions.hint: A member of a country enjoying rights and privileges; The group of people a kind rules over

questions.text: Between 1933 and 1939, there were over ___ decrees and regulations that restricted aspects of public and private life, especially for Jews
Known in English as ___
questions.hint: A night where windows of Jewish shops, houses, and synagogues were smashed

questions.text: 500,000 Jews were blamed for ___, ___, and the Great ___
questions.hint: The first world war; A massive inflation in prices and devaluation of money; A severe economic recession

questions.text: In 1938, Germany announced that residence permits for foreigners needed to be ___ or the bearer would be expelled from Germany
questions.hint: A re-registration of a permit

questions.text: True or false? Poland reluctantly agreed to take all Jews of Polish origin
In 1938, ___ jews were expelled from Germany
Among the Jews trapped at the Polish border was the ___ family
questions.hint: Starts with 'g'

questions.text: Their son ___ was in Paris with an uncle. When he received their postcard telling him about their terrible circumstances, he purchased a weapon, went to the German embassy, and shot ___ vom Rath
questions.hint: Starts with 'h'; Starts with 'e'

questions.text: True or false? Ernst vom Rath survived his injuries
True or false? Goebbels took advantage of the situation in Hitler's absence after learning of Ernst vom Rath's death, and organized a Germany and Austria-wide pogrom
The pogrom made to look spontaneous, but it was actually instigated by the ___ paramilitary (brownshirts)
questions.hint: A paramilitary group that were very prominent in the early years of the Nazi party

questions.text: True or false? The SA were the only ones that smashed Jewish establishments during the Kristallnacht
True or false? The police tried to stop the looting and destruction, but they were overwhelmed

questionSets.focus: Anti-Nazi Resistance in the Third Reich

questions.text: True or false? There was almost no organized resistance to Hitler's regime between 1933 and 1938
During Nazi rule, other political parties and ___ were suppressed
questions.hint: An organization that fights for the rights of workers

questions.text: The Nazis tightly controlled the ___ and the ___
questions.hint: Two major forms of German news coverage

questions.text: During this time, the SPD and KPD maintained ___
questions.hint: Communication networks that go without government notice

questions.text: The ___ managed to infiltrate many of these networks and get some of the members executed
questions.hint: Germany's secret police force

questions.text: These underground parties had a lot of recruits from the ___ class due to the stringent labour discipline imposed by the Nazis
questions.hint: Members of the working class who do industrial work

questions.text: True or false? These parties achieved a lot before the Nazis crushed them entirely
Germany signed a concordat with the Catholic Church in ___
questions.hint: The year the Nazis came to power

questions.text: True or false? Catholic opposition to the Nazi government mostly ended after the concordat was signed
True or false? Many attempts were made on Hitler's life
One assassination attempt was carried out in 1944 by several German officers. They used a modified version of a plan called ___ to take control of the country after Hitler was assassinated
questions.hint: An operation for continuity of government in the case of a major breakdown in the civil order

questions.text: True or false? Operation Valkyrie failed due to the generals' failure to assassinate Hitler
Another assassination attempt was by George ___, who planted a bomb in a pillar near where Hitler was to give a speech
questions.hint: Starts with 'e'

questions.text: George Elser's plan failed because: a) his bomb failed to go off, or b) Hitler finished his speech early
Elser was kept as a special prisoner for 5 years without trial, and was later killed at ___
questions.hint: Starts with a 'd'

questions.text: The Nazis saw war in the Polish lands as a '___ mission'
questions.hint: The act oof bringing civilization to an uncivilized place

questions.text: Another motivation for the war on Poland was that the Nazis felt Germany needed more ___
questions.hint: Germany word, translates to 'living space'

questions.text: One goal was to reclaim ___
questions.hint: Land that Germany believed had been taken away from it

questions.text: Another goal was to turn the Slavic people into a ___
questions.hint: A race of subjugated people

questions.text: True or false? Large numbers of Poles were expelled to make way for Germans
Polish Jews were forced into ___
questions.hint: A part of a city, especially a slum area, occupied by minority groups

questions.text: Many Jews were sent to ___ camps and ___ camps
questions.hint: A camp where a large number of people are kept without trial; A camp where people are forced into slave labour

questions.text: During their occupation of Poland, the Nazis: a) destroyed cultural monuments, b) looted museums and libraries, c) censored entertainment for Polish people only, d) restricted education for Polish people only, e) all of the above
True or false? Germany exported 1.5 million Polish labourers back to Germany to work as slaves during 1939-1945
Of the 5 million civilian deaths, ___ million were Jewish
Poland was split between Germany and ___
questions.hint: A major eastern power of the time

questions.text: The German part of Poland was divided into the General Government and the ___
questions.hint: Territories that are not part of Germany, but were incorporated into the reich

questions.text: True or false? The Nazis imprisoned or killed 48,000 Polish members of the 'elite', such as teachers, priests, bureaucrats, etc.
This plan to eliminate the Polish elite and undermine resistance was known as the ___
questions.hint: Starts with 'a'

questions.text: True or false? The Nazis kidnapped 50,000 Polish children who had 'German blood' and sent them to live with Germany families
Hitler's first 'defeat' was when ___ refused to sue for peace
questions.hint: An island nation off the coast of Europe

questions.text: Hitler had plans to also invade ___ against the protests of his advisors
questions.hint: The country that Germany agreed to divide Poland with

questions.text: True or false? The Nazi generals did not want a two-front war with Russia
The positive public image of Hitler was maintained through ___
questions.hint: Material spread by a government seeking to influence the public

questions.text: The German people wanted a ___ man to get Germany out of its economic slump and the Treaty of Versaille
questions.hint: Another word for powerful

questions.text: Hitler was portrayed as a hero of ___
questions.hint: The first great world war

questions.text: Hitler was popular partially because of his promise for justice over ___ and ___
questions.answer: world war 1, the treaty of versaille
questions.hint: The first great war; The treaty Germany was forced into at the end of the war

questions.text: True or false? Hitler was portrayed as the latest in a line of glorious Germany leaders
True or false? Hitler meticulously micromanaged every decision in the Nazi government
True or false? Hitler made very few key decisions within the government
True or false? Many of Hitler's followers within the party went out of their way to please or impress him, doing things that he didn't specifically order
Germany and Russia signed a non-aggression pact between them in ___
questions.hint: The year the war broke out

questions.text: Germany invaded Russia in ___
questions.hint: 2 years after the start of the war

questions.text: Germany invaded Russia with ___ million men
The Nazis' invasion of Russia was positioned as a crusade against ___
questions.hint: The Russian communist government system of the time

questions.text: True or false? The Russian Red Army knew the Nazis were coming
The German advance made it to ___
questions.hint: Russia's capital city

questions.text: Stalin rallied the people and implemented a ___ policy to deter the Germans
questions.hint: Destroying anything usable as you retreat so your enemy cannot use it

questions.text: The cold and rainy ___ also hampered the Germans' invasion effort
True or false? After the failure of the German invasion, the Russians mounted a counter-offensive that drove the Germans back
This war is referred to as a 'war of ___'
questions.hint: A system of political or economic ideals

questions.text: True or false? During the German-Russian war, the German army adhered to the Geneva Conventions governing armed warfare
The Nazis saw the German-Russian war as a 'War of ___'
questions.hint: To wipe from existence

questions.text: In 1943, Goebbels called for ___ against the Russians
questions.hint: The involvement of the entire country in a war effort

questions.text: True or false? This war was a major defeat and a major turning point for Nazi Germany
The bombing of Hamburg was referred to by the Allies as 'Operation ___'
questions.hint: One of the biblical cities that was destroyed for its immorality

questions.text: The goals of the Allied bombing missions were to destroy Germany ___, ___ lines, and ___ production
questions.hint: Communications; Method of moving goods from one place to another; A substance necessary to move the German vehicles

questions.text: Other goals of the bombing operation were to reduce the 'material ___ for war' and to weaken civilian ___
questions.hint: The ability to do something; The emotional state of the people in a time of war

questions.text: True or false? Beside Operation Gomorrah, other German cities were also bombed
The bombings were carried out by the ___ and the ___ air forces
questions.hint: An island nation off the coast of Europe; One of Britain's former colonies

questions.text: The dropping of bombs in Hamburg created a ___
questions.hint: A storm of fire

questions.text: True or false? The bombings made people angry at Hitler
True or false? Despite the bombings, Germans still wanted Hitler to continue the war
True or false? The civilians were worried about what would happen to them when the Allies found out what Germany had done
True or false? Although they were allowed to live outside them, many Jews felt forced into Jewish 'ghettos'
True or false? Jews living in these ghettos were allowed to do what they wanted as long as they didn't leave
Many ghettos were ___
questions.hint: Closed so nobody can escape

questions.text: The ghettos were extremely ___
questions.hint: A lack of space to fit everything in

questions.text: True or false? Sealed ghettos were mostly situated in German-occupied Poland
Jews in sealed ghettos suffered from shortages of __, lack of ___, and inadequate municipal ___, leading to outbreaks of dysentery, typhus, and a high mortality rate
questions.hint: Things to eat; Warmth; Services

questions.text: The German wartime ration for ghetto inhabitants was ___ calories per day
The poor food conditions led to a lot of ___ activity and smuggling
questions.hint: A market for illegal goods

questions.text: The Einsatzgruppen were mobile ___ squads
questions.hint: Starts with 'k'

questions.text: True or false? The Einsatzgruppen accompied German troops into Soviet territory as Operation Barbarossa progressed, rounding up Jews and shooting them
Some members of the Einsatzgruppen were from the SS or the army, but most were ___
questions.hint: Enforcers of the law

questions.text: True or false? The officers of the Einsatzgruppen were highly educated
Slight changes in German law relating to Russian political commisars made it legal to ___
questions.hint: Kill the Nazis' most hated enemy

questions.text: Besides Jews, the Einsatzgruppen killed thousands of ___ and ___ people
questions.hint: A nomadic people that are discriminated against in Europe; People who have some disability

questions.text: Auschwitz-Birkenau was a concentration camp for: a) German prisoners, b) Polish political prisoners, c) prisoners of war, d) all of the above
questions.hint: Everyone is welcome at Auschwitz!

questions.text: In 1941, a slave labour camp was added, and the original was expanded for ___ prisoners of war
questions.hint: Communists

questions.text: The Nazis experimented with ___ and then ___ for efficiently killing Jews
questions.hint: A gas emitted by cars; Starts with 'z'

questions.text: Jews started being killed this way in ___
questions.hint: 3 years before the end of the war

questions.text: Jews deported from across Europe to the death camps were told to pack for '___ in the East'
questions.hint: Moving people back into their homes

questions.text: The prisoners arriving at the camps were separated into those who were ___, and the elderly, disabled, sick, and children with their mothers
questions.hint: In a condition that allowed them to work

questions.text: The Nazis killed between 10,000 and ___ per day
Jews were identified in the camps by a ___
questions.hint: The symbol of the Jewish people

questions.text: True or false? The Allies were the first to discover the death camps
The first people to discover the death camps were the ___
questions.hint: The country Germany had lost a war to

questions.text: When he found out the Russians were coming, Himmler forced the surviving prisoners into a ___
questions.hint: Making a group of people walk until they die

questions.text: True or false? The Nazis did not have enough time to destroy records of what they had done before retreating
In Maus, mice represent the ___
questions.hint: The Nazis' most hated enemy

questions.text: In Maus, the cats represent the ___
questions.hint: The country that lost World War 2

questions.text: In Maus, the fish represent the ___
questions.hint: An island nation off the coast of Europe

questions.text: In Maus, the pigs represent the ___
questions.hint: An Eastern European country that was split between Germany and Russia

questions.text: In Maus, the dogs represent the ___
questions.hint: A former British colony in North American

questions.text: In Maus, the frogs represent the ___
questions.hint: A country that Germany wanted to get revenge on for the Treaty of Versaille
